page.title: 03LANDSCAPE
page.content: {Chelford}has a lot of woodland and pastures.Field boundaries are mainly hedges and fences. There are lakes, ponds and streams .There are two streams one called Snape Brook and the other Bag Brook, both running westward into Astle Lake.There is a stream called the Peover Eye which runs southward out of this artificial lake.Throughout the block,there are views of the Pennines to the East.It is a beautiful place to live.Chelford is almost flat being gently undulating with a few higher hillocks. It is very quiet away from the busy main roads. There is a church yard and an old private park called Astle Park which belonged to Astle Hall.Apart from a few outbuildings,this Hall is now demolished. Withington Hall,to the south of the block, is well hidden by trees from the A535 road.
